meanings.definition: To have made ready or prepared
meanings.sent1: She dighted the table for the guests by setting out the plates and silverware.
meanings.sent2: The chef dighted the ingredients before starting to cook the meal.
meanings.sent3: He dighted the room for the surprise party, making sure everything was in place.
meanings.sent4: The team dighted their strategy for the upcoming match, ensuring they were well-prepared.
meanings.sent5: The students dighted their presentations with colorful visuals to make them more engaging.

meanings.sent1: She dighted the Christmas tree with sparkling lights and shiny ornaments.
meanings.sent2: The artist dighted the canvas with vibrant colors to create a beautiful painting.
meanings.sent3: The children dighted the classroom with handmade decorations for the school event.
meanings.sent4: Her smile dighted the room, bringing joy to everyone present.
meanings.sent5: The garden was dighted with blooming flowers, creating a picturesque scene.

meanings.definition: To have cleaned or wiped clean
meanings.sent1: She dighted the kitchen counter with a fresh cloth after preparing the meal.
meanings.sent2: The janitor dighted the floors of the school hallway every evening.
meanings.sent3: He dighted the dusty bookshelf, making it look brand new.
meanings.sent4: The rain dighted the car, washing away the dirt and grime.
meanings.sent5: The maid dighted the windows until they sparkled in the sunlight.
